derivation.yuyuan_name: early 16th cent.: from Old English chesten (from Old French chastaine, via Latin from Greek kastanea) + nut

entry.def: A chestnut or chestnut tree is a tall tree with broad leaves.
Chestnuts are the reddish-brown nuts that grow on chestnut trees. You can eat chestnuts.
Something that is chestnut is dark reddish-brown in colour.

entry.tran: 老掉牙的话(或故事、笑话);老一套
entry.def: If you refer to a statement, a story, or a joke as an old chestnut or a hoary chestnut, you mean that it has been repeated so often that it is no longer interesting.

example.ex: ...that old chestnut, the war between man and machines.
example.tran: 又是老掉牙的故事：人机大战

means.word_mean: 1. wood of any of various chestnut trees of the genus Castanea
2. any of several attractive deciduous trees yellow-brown in autumn; yield a hard wood and edible nuts in a prickly bur
3. edible nut of any of various chestnut trees of the genus Castanea
4. a small horny callus on the inner surface of a horse's leg
5. a dark golden-brown or reddish-brown horse
1. used of hair; of a golden brown to reddish brown color;
